subject: Programming
title: Code Reviews as Teaching
description: A quick win: understand Code Reviews as Teaching.

hook.text: Code reviews aren't about catching mistakes. They're about spreading knowledge across the team.

buildup.text: A reviewer sees patterns, alternatives, and risks the author missed while deep in the problem.

discovery.text: Junior developers learn faster from reviews than from any course. Real code, real feedback.

twist.text: Harsh reviews shut people down. The best reviewers ask questions instead of giving orders.

climax.text: Great review cultures produce great code. Toxic reviews produce fear and hidden shortcuts.

punchline.text: Review the code, respect the person.

quiz.question: What is the primary value of code reviews?
options: Proving who is the best coder
